item.title: metaprogramming with map(quo) %>% reduce
item.description: Ever since I discovered the rlang function ‘expr’ I have become mildy obsessed with the idea of writing code which writes code (I think this falls under the banner of metaprogramming, hence the title of this post). Before launching into anything genuinely useful, some background is required: R is an ‘eagerly evaluated’ language, which means if you write: a <- 50 and then just write a and hit enter you get:
